Uses of EventSocket in nano.remexp.broadcaster
 

Methods in nano.remexp.broadcaster with parameters of type EventSocket
protected  void RemoteExperimentMonitor.addClientRequest(java.lang.String message, EventSocket sock)
          Receives a client event and searches for the command=value value in order to determine whether this command is allowed to be passed to the remote experiment and whether a lock needs to be set until the action is finished and the remote experiment answered to be ready again.
 void RemoteExperimentBroadcaster.login(EventSocket sock, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass)
          Not used for remote experiment socket.
 void FilteringPool.login(EventSocket sock, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass)
          if no password is delivered this function tries to check this client's access rights through the booking server.
 void RemoteExperimentBroadcaster.performSocketEvent(EventSocket sock, java.lang.String message)
          Remote experiment sends event thus this has to be processed and delivered further.
 void FilteringPool.performSocketEvent(EventSocket sock, java.lang.String message)
          The pool receives a message from the client and passes it to the remote experiment monitor if the remote experiment isn't busy at the moment.
 void RemoteExperimentBroadcaster.removeEventSocket(EventSocket sock)
          This method removes the event socket to the remote experiment.
 void FilteringPool.removeEventSocket(EventSocket sock)
          If the event socket stops to read the in buffer and thus exits the loop it calls this method in order to remove the socket from the vector that holds the client event sockets.
protected  void RemoteExperimentMonitor.sendCurrentStateTo(EventSocket sock)
          Informs the new client about the current state of the remote experiment.
